Description: Lower body sherd (mended from two fragments) of Chian, possibly Wild Goat Style, pottery chalice; white slip; interior: glazed streaky black (almost completely worn); exterior: single wide streaky black band; inscription on interior.
Curator's comments: Very little remains of the sherd. The wide streaky band at the bottom of the bowl is consistent with the Wild Goat Style. The black bands on later chalices tend to be much narrower.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0125) (phase 2)
